body: One of the four young men accused of beating two Brooklyn College students in what the police called an anti-Semitic attack last year has pleaded guilty to a charge of riot and will testify against the other defendants, a prosecutor said in court yesterday. title: Defendant to Testify in Bias Case

body: LIKE the IRT express, restaurant developers in recent years have bypassed most stops on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. But not Arthur Cutler, whose places attract standing-room-only crowds. body: A Pakistani man was assaulted by a marine and a companion on a Brooklyn-bound subway train early Saturday, the transit police reported, listing the incident as a bias attack. title: 2 Held in Bias Attack on Pakistani in Subway

body: The Daily News, struck by nine of its 10 unions, began dismissing most of its 2,400 unionized workers yesterday and then struggled to publish without them, gathering an army of nonunion employees, some from across the country, to write, edit, print and deliver the nation's second-largest metropolitan daily. With scores of replacement drivers,
title: DAILY NEWS DROPS UNION EMPLOYEES

body: LEAD: A New York City deputy police inspector shot and killed a cabdriver Wednesday night in Brooklyn as the driver advanced on him with a tire iron after a minor traffic accident, the police said. title: Officer Kills a Cabby In a Street Showdown

body: LEAD: New York's new striped bass regulations went into effect yesterday and sport fishermen are now allowed to take one bass a day 36 or more inches long, and a limited commercial harvest of smaller fish will be permitted. title: Outdoors; Shorter Striped Bass Restrictions

body: LEAD: A 30-minute power failure affected 6,000 customers yesterday in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn. title: Power Failure in Brooklyn

body: LEAD: Eric Sorensen, a tall blond from Nebraska, was acting in New York in ''As the World Turns'' and other television shows when he learned that he had the AIDS virus. body: LEAD: FRIDAY THE NEW SPANISH DANCE FRIDAY THE NEW SPANISH DANCE Spain has a rich and ancient culture, but that does not mean its passion for the arts is all in the past. Tonight and tomorrow at 8 o'clock, a half-dozen modern-minded Spanish choreographers will show how their country not only keeps up but also runs forward in the field of dance.
title: GOING OUT GUIDE
